abstract: Bank of America posts third-quarter profit of $2.5 billion. | Twitter disclosed new revenue information. | JPMorgan Chase has reached a preliminary agreement to admit a trading blowup represented reckless behavior. | With the political stalemate, a crucial part of the financial system is becoming a concern.
snippet: Bank of America posts third-quarter profit of $2.5 billion. | Twitter disclosed new revenue information. | JPMorgan Chase has reached a preliminary agreement to admit a trading blowup represented reckless behavior. | With the political stalemate, ...
lead_paragraph: Bank of America reported on Wednesday that third-quarter net income rose to $2.5 billion, or 20 cents a share, from $340 million in the period a year earlier, when the bank was hit by litigation expenses and other charges. Revenue, excluding a financial charge that investors often ignore, fell slightly, to $22.2 billion, from $22.5 billion in the period a year earlier. At the same time, the bank’s mortgage operations faltered, underscoring that home loans remain a challenging business for the industry. Bank of America is holding a conference call to discuss the results at 8:30 a.m.

headline.main: Earnings Jump at Bank of America

abstract: Wall Street is feeling the effects of a Commodity Futures Trading Commission rule it fought hard to tame.
snippet: Wall Street is feeling the effects of a Commodity Futures Trading Commission rule it fought hard to tame.
lead_paragraph: Updated, 8:49 p.m. | Lobbying groups for Wall Street’s biggest banks cautioned that a new rule before the nation’s commodities trading regulator “could have myriad unintended adverse consequences.” A hedge fund trade group feared that the rule was “overly aggressive.” And the CME Group, one of the world’s largest futures exchanges, warned that the rule was susceptible to legal action.

headline.main: A Regulator Cuts New Teeth on JPMorgan in ‘London Whale’ Case
headline.print_headline: A Regulator Cuts Its New Teeth On JPMorgan in ‘Whale’ Case

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

abstract: Warren E. Buffett offers an unusual defense of Jamie Dimon, comparing the billions of dollars that JPMorgan Chase has paid in fines to state troopers handing out a speeding ticket.
snippet: Warren E. Buffett offers an unusual defense of Jamie Dimon, comparing the billions of dollars that JPMorgan Chase has paid in fines to state troopers handing out a speeding ticket.
lead_paragraph: Warren E. Buffett offered an unusual defense of Jamie Dimon on Wednesday morning, comparing the billions of dollars that JPMorgan Chase has paid in fines to state troopers handing out a speeding ticket.

headline.main: Warren Buffett on Driving Violations, Baseball and Jamie Dimon

abstract: Under the $25 billion national mortgage settlement intended to help at-risk homeowners, more gave up their homes in short sales than stayed in their homes through debt reduction.
snippet: Under the $25 billion national mortgage settlement intended to help at-risk homeowners, more gave up their homes in short sales than stayed in their homes through debt reduction.
lead_paragraph: The $25 billion national mortgage settlement, intended to help homeowners affected by the housing crisis, appears to be running ahead of schedule, according to a new report by the monitor of the program.

headline.main: Settlement Report Finds Banks Giving Timely Mortgage Relief
headline.print_headline: Settlement Report Finds Banks Giving Timely Mortgage Relief
